Description: Fragment body of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery slim neck-amphora; incised lines. Body (on both A and B), satyr assaulting maenad, another satyr assisting: dividing band of white dots with dark centres: sirens (there were originally six). Purple stripe on forepart of wing of siren. White dots between pairs of incised lines on maenad's skirt; maenands' feet are white. The front contour of the satyr's left thigh is doubled, the two flanking lines are breaks.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29
Curator's comments: Originally (to judge by the height of the main panel) it must have been unusually tall. BMC B.114. BSA xlvii, 129-B.19.
reconstructed with BM GR 1888,0208.74.c, on which Findspot number '29' is pencilled.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B114)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 583, 1)

Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.211)
